dt: {bc}to agitate (milk or cream) in a {d_link|churn|churn:1} in order to make butter

dt.t: The farmer {wi}churns{/wi} his cream every day.
an old stern-wheeler {wi}churning{/wi} the muddy river
larger particles pound and {wi}churn{/wi} the Moon's surface

dt: {bc}to make (something, such as foam) by so doing
{bc}to make (the account of a client) excessively active by frequent purchases and sales primarily in order to generate commissions

dt.t: unscrupulous brokers may {wi}churn{/wi} an account, trading frequently to generate high commissions

dt: {bc}to work a churn (as in making butter)
{bc}to produce, proceed with, or experience violent motion or agitation
{bc}to proceed by or as if by means of rotating members (such as wheels or propellers)

shortdef: to agitate (milk or cream) in a churn in order to make butter
to make (something, such as foam) by so doing

dt.t: the usual pap which has been {it}churned out{/it} about this superstar

shortdef: to produce mechanically or copiously : grind out

dt: {bc}to proceed through, process, or deal with rapidly or steadily in a mechanical or seemingly mechanical way

dt.t: He {wi}churned through{/wi} Princeton in two years, working himself into a state of near exhaustion.
For an aggressive trader who {wi}churns through{/wi} 30 or 40 deals a day, the stakes mount quickly—along with the tensions.

shortdef: to proceed through, process, or deal with rapidly or steadily in a mechanical or seemingly mechanical way
